articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Putin backs Trump's push for Ukraine ceasefire in principle, but says "there are issues" to discuss with U.S.
articles.description: Russia's Vladimir Putin said he agrees in principle with a U.S. proposal for a 30-day ceasefire in Ukraine, but that the terms need to be worked out.
articles.content:
Russian President Vladimir Putin said Thursday that he agrees in principle with a U.S. proposal for a 30-day ceasefire in Ukraine, but that the terms need to be worked out, and he emphasized that it should pave the way to lasting peace.

articles.title: The Trump administration demands UN agencies disclose any 'anti-American' ties
articles.description: The Trump administration is demanding U.N. humanitarian agencies that receive or disburse U.S. funding to fill out a questionnaire disclosing any ties to communism, socialism or anti-American beliefs.

articles.title: Trump floats Canada and Greenland takeovers in meeting with NATO chief
articles.description: In the meeting, Trump also applied new pressure on the trans-Atlantic alliance to spend more on its collective defense.
articles.content:
President Donald Trump mused at length over his desire to absorb two countries protected by the NATO alliance on Thursday in a White House meeting with Secretary-General Mark Rutte.

articles.title: Harvard researchers sue the Trump administration for removing their work from public website
articles.description: Two Harvard researchers said in a lawsuit that the Trump administration removed their work from a public website because it referenced the LGBTQ community.
articles.content:
Two Harvard medical school professors claim in a lawsuit filed against the Trump administration that their research was pulled from a public government website because it referred to the LGBTQ community.

articles.title: Wine Businesses Fear Disaster in Threat of Huge Tariffs
articles.description: President Trump’s threat to impose 200 percent fees on European wines could harm importers, distributors, retailers and restaurants without necessarily helping U.S. producers.
articles.content:
It’s not clear who will benefit if President Trump follows through on his threat to impose 200 percent tariffs on all wines and alcoholic beverages from the European Union, but it certainly would not be American consumers.
